title: Are there any living modern descendants of the ancient Egyptians? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, there are and they are not who delusional Eurocentrists say they are. They are indigenous Africans and people of the Nile. Egypt is a Nile-Land first and foremost like 10 other African countries. There is a popular saying regarding Whites among Native Americans as follows. The saying was shared on a popular forum. The whole purpose of the Pale Face bas been and will always .be to breed out the original inhabitants, create a fixed mixed race (the paler, the better), claim their identiy, steal their legacy and shut out the Natives all races. Whites call it racial whitening; but it is genocide and theft of history. It has been proven time and time again whenever and wherever Whites invaded lands and later claimed them as their own ancestral lands. Google search racial whitening in Latin America, Cabinda, Australia etc. The ancient Egyptian race lives on among rural Fellahin and the Saidi of Upper Egypt. They are the closest to what ancient Egyptians looked like and how they functioned in society. They still follow old customs and practice ancient rituals inherited from the Pharaohs. More importantly, the Fellahin and the Saidi are the darkest and blackest Egyptians. Eurasian invaders did not care much to mix with the Fellahin, the poor peasants. The Saidi were mostly out of reach as the Eurasian invaders came by the Mediterranean Sea miles away from Upper Egypt. Last but not least, a founding father of Egyptology Champollion-Figeac wrote that the first tribes that inhabited Egypt that is the Nile Valley between the Syene cataracts and the sea came from Abyssinia to Sennar. the ancient Egyptian race belongs to a race quite similar to the Kennous or Barabras, present inhabitants of Nubia.

I have read some answers here and I wonder why some people like Tamizh Deva, Walter Smyth are a little misinformed about history. Most people dont understand or know the origin of ancient Egypt. When they discuss on ancient Egypt, they base their discussions on a later date mainly around the Roman rule. They simply forget that during that era, ancient Egypt had already been ruled by foreigners for almost 1,000 years, many of the foreigners had migrated and settled in the lush Delta region. Tamizh Deva put out some set of Mummy portraits depicting mostly Greek Upper class elites who were very predominant in Fayum. But he fails to explain why there are Mummy portraits that shows a significant number of Native Egyptians who were part of the Mummy portraits.   It is on record that Greeks migrated and settled mainly in Alexandria and Fayum. Here is a famous quote from Strabo.  It is very dishonest to use the Greek/Roman Egypt as a basis of who the ancient Egyptians were. We need to go back before there were foreign invaders in the ancient Kingdom. The ancient Egyptians described the migration of the Hyksos from the Levant region in their ancient arts.  The Hyksos invaded and migrated into Northern Egypt around 1650 BC. They founded the city of Avaris and their were responsible for the 14th to 16th dynasty of ancient Egypt. You can clearly see the depictions of both distinct people. They were not clearly not the same!! So who were the ancient Egyptians? History tells us that King Namer came from the South and conqured the North, subjugating the North culturally and politically.  According to archaeological findings, the earliest Pharaohnic Monarchy began in Qustul, a region that was referred to as Lower Nubia in Modern day Aswan. Below is a chart of the earliest Pharaohnic Monarchies before the first dynasty of ancient Egypt.  You can find the entire thesis in the link below. https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=https://oi.uchicago.edu/sites/oi.uchicago.edu/files/uploads/shared/docs/oine3.pdf&ved=2ahUKEwjQwuagrtreAhVHKBoKHUPMDMwQFjABegQICRAB&usg=AOvVaw2gl2jnYLHImdKyWXF0QE3B&cshid=1542421058394 These are hard facts and evidences put together by the UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE, under the authority of Dr Keith C Seele from the University of Chicago. Ancient Egypt had an origin which was in the Upper Nile of Aswan. According to Diodorus, an ancient Greek historian, he wrote that…   LacusCurtius • Diodorus Siculus So I have provided both Historical and Archaeological facts about the origin of ancient Egypt by modern and ancient sources. Which both supports that ancient Egypt originated from the Southern Upper Nile Valley. So in order to know who the true descendants of the ancient Egyptians are we need to go to the Upper Nile Valley and see it's people.  Again, another confusion that Tamizh Deva made was the Coptic language. The Coptic was introduced by the Greeks and it was used to transcribe the Demotic (Introduced in Egypt duringthe Kushite Rule 25th dynasty). The Coptic comprised of majorly Greek alphabets.  It was not a language but a literal system.

No, not really but based on genetic evidence (cited in this article Ancient Egyptian mummy genomes suggest an increase of Sub-Saharan African ancestry in post-Roman periods and elsewhere) recently obtained we have gained a clearer understanding of history. The majority of reference DNA for ancient Egypt is from pharaohs and mummies that have been tested and shown to be surprisingly different than modern Egyptians across the board. (A Genetic Study Revealed That Ancient Egyptians Were Closer to Armenians Than to Africans ) Lineages found amongst modern Armenians would most likely classify as having the closest genetic affinity to the ancient people of Egypt . So not as living descendants, but with ascendant genetic affinity based on preserved DNA samples i.e. Mummies of the pharaohs and others showing close genetic affinity. Now this is all relevant upon further studies that have been done on matrilineal genetic continuity in Armenia (Eight Millennia of Matrilineal Genetic Continuity in the South Caucasus and A New Study Reveals 8000 Years of Genetic Continuity in Armenia - PeopleOfAr) that allow us to consider this entire hypothesis. The Armenians display the closest affinity to the ancient Egyptians genetically. The entirety of the Egyptian people underwent extensive cultural admixture over time (approx. 1400 bc to 1400 ad), so their descendants are diverse and numerous as are Armenians but at the same time very far removed from the ancient population, unlike Armenians (continuity within the female gene pool.) There's so much more hidden in history than any of us thought.

Yes, of course. Their descendants are the modern inhabitants of Egypt, who also have some admixture of other peoples, usually rulers/invaders, in their genetic makeup. This admixture is somewhat less among Copts - the Egyptians who remained Christian in the face of the gradual Islamisation of the country - but modern Egyptians in general, both Christian and Muslim, are the ethnic group in the world today who have the most ancient Egyptian ancestry. Many people who do not know the history of Egypt labour under the misunderstanding that ancient Egyptians were somehow demographically displaced by ‘Arabs’ from elsewhere. Yes, Egypt’s culture became ‘Arabised’ along with the process of Islamisation from the 7th century onward, because the first Muslim armies and rulers were from the Arabian peninsula. But the adoption of Arabic-Islamic culture is not the same thing as wholesale demographic change. The Arab rulers remained a small minority. Likewise, when Egypt was ruled by the Macedonian Greek dynasty of the Ptolemies from 323 to 30 BC, the bulk of the population remained, well, Egyptian. They didn’t suddenly become Greeks, although Greek language and culture exerted a significant influence. An analogy closer in time to the present: the fact that Catholicism and the Spanish language came to the Andean countries in South America - due to conquest - does not mean that everyone in those countries became genetically ‘Spanish’. The population there is still descended from the Incas and other pre-Columbian peoples, with some admixture from the European colonialists.

My whole family is: what’s your verdict?

Yes, the Egyptians are still in place.  Scientists found the ancient Egyptian genome remained surprisingly consistent for well over 1,800 years.   After this period, a sub saharan “Black” African admix of 6-8% occurs within the past 700 years, presumably as the result of owning black slaves. Egyptian Copts retain the purest, most pristine genome to their ancient ancestors as their faith prevented them from mixing with “black” sub saharan ex slaves who converted to Islam.     Even so, modern day and ancient Egyptians share the same genome (no greater than 15% differential) and are verifiably the same people group. The DNA in modern Egyptians has the Y haplogroup that determines lineage, which makes it biologically impossible for them to be invaders who aren’t indigenous to Egypt  The results of several studies are proving this point_ " The data from our successfully genotyped samples do not suggest a foreign origin, so can be considered representing the local community profile "﻿ Ancient Egyptian mummy genomes suggest an increase of Sub-Saharan African ancestry in post-Roman periods
